required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of Preoperative MM-121 With Paclitaxel in HER2-negative Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Phase 2 Trial of Preoperative MM-121 With Paclitaxel in HER2-negative Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: To demonstrate whether addition of MM-121 to paclitaxel is more effective than treatment with paclitaxel alone, when administered as part of the neoadjuvant treatment in Her2 negative locally advanced operable breast cancer patients.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a multicenter, open-label, randomized, Phase II study of preoperative MM-121 with paclitaxel in HER2-negative breast cancer. Patients will be randomized to receive paclitaxel with or without MM-121 for 12 weeks followed by 4 cycles of doxorubicin plus cyclophosphamide and subsequent surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Pathologic Complete Response (pCR) (Rate of pCR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: At time of surgery, an expected average of 24-26 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Pathologic Complete Response was defined as the absence of invasive cancer in the breast and lymph nodes following completion of neoadjuvant systemic therapy and reported according to the current AJCC staging system for neoadjuvant clinical studies. The endpoint was to determine the pathologic Complete Response (pCR) rates associated with weekly treatment of MM-121 plus paclitaxel followed by the combination treatment of doxorubicin plus cyclophosphamide compared with weekly paclitaxel alone followed by the combination treatment of doxorubicin plus cyclophosphamide in patients with human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2)-negative primary breast cancer.

clinical_study.condition: ER Positive, Her2 Negative Breast Cancer Patients

arm_group.description: 2 week run-in of MM-121 followed by MM-121 + dosing of paclitaxel IV, followed by standard dosing of doxorubicin IV plus cyclophosphamide IV, followed by surgery.
Standard dosing of paclitaxel IV, followed by standard dosing of doxorubicin IV plus cyclophosphamide IV, followed by surgery.

intervention.description: MM-121 IV at 40 mg/mg loading dose on Cycle 1, Week 1 followed by 20 mg/mg weekly for all subsequent doses
Standard dosing of paclitaxel IV, followed by standard dosing of doxorubicin IV plus cyclophosphamide IV, followed by surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histological confirmation of ER positive, HER2 negative invasive breast cancer (Group 1) or invasive triple-negative breast cancer (Group 2)
- Free of metastatic disease
- ≥ 18 years old
- Female
- Had no prior treatment for any cancer
- Eligible for treatment with paclitaxel, doxorubicin and cyclophosphamide
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have a history of severe allergic reactions to paclitaxel or other drugs formulated in Cremaphor® EL
- Are pregnant or breastfeeding

facility.name: University of New Mexico Cancer Center
Texas Oncology - Baylor Charles A Sammons Cancer Center
Cancer Care Centers of South Texas

group.title: HR+: MM-121+ Paclitaxel
group.description: Hormone-receptor positive (HR+) sub-group randomized to receive: 2 week run-in of MM-121 (20 mg/kg weekly IV infusion over 60 minutes following a 40 mg/kg loading dose), followed by 4 cycles of MM-121 (20 mg/kg weekly) + Paclitaxel (80 mg/kg IV infusion weekly over 60 minutes) for 12 weeks, followed by 4 cycles of doxorubicin and cyclophosphamide (8 weeks)

group.title: HR+: Paclitaxel Only
group.description: Hormone-receptor positive (HR+) sub-group randomized to receive: Paclitaxel (80 mg/kg IV infusion weekly over 60 minutes) for 12 weeks followed by standard dosing of doxorubicin IV plus cyclophosphamide IV, followed by surgery.

group.title: TN: MM-121 + Paclitaxel
group.description: Triple Negative (TN) patients randomized to receive: 2 week run-in of MM-121 (20 mg/kg weekly IV infusion over 60 minutes following a 40 mg/kg loading dose), followed by 4 cycles of MM-121 (20 mg/kg weekly) + Paclitaxel (80 mg/kg IV infusion weekly over 60 minutes) for 12 weeks, followed by 4 cycles of doxorubicin and cyclophosphamide (8 weeks)

group.title: TN: Paclitaxel
group.description: Triple negative (TN) patients randomized to receive: Paclitaxel (80 mg/kg IV infusion weekly over 60 minutes) for 12 weeks followed by standard dosing of doxorubicin IV plus cyclophosphamide IV, followed by surgery.

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.description: Pathologic Complete Response was defined as the absence of invasive cancer in the breast and lymph nodes following completion of neoadjuvant systemic therapy and reported according to the current AJCC staging system for neoadjuvant clinical studies. The endpoint was to determine the pathologic Complete Response (pCR) rates associated with weekly treatment of MM-121 plus paclitaxel followed by the combination treatment of doxorubicin plus cyclophosphamide compared with weekly paclitaxel alone followed by the combination treatment of doxorubicin plus cyclophosphamide in patients with human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2)-negative primary breast cancer.

measure.description: Pathologic Complete Response was defined as the absence of invasive cancer in the breast and lymph nodes following completion of neoadjuvant systemic therapy and reported according to the current AJCC staging system for neoadjuvant clinical studies. The endpoint was to determine the pathologic Complete Response (pCR) rates associated with weekly treatment of MM-121 plus paclitaxel followed by the combination treatment of doxorubicin plus cyclophosphamide compared with weekly paclitaxel alone followed by the combination treatment of doxorubicin plus cyclophosphamide in patients with human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2)-negative primary breast cancer.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from a patient's first dose until 30 days after treatment termination. Serious adverse events were collected from time of informed consent until 30 days after treatment termination, or any time when assumed to be related
reported_events.desc: All related AEs ongoing at the time of treatment discontinuation were followed until resolution. Investigators were to report any AEs/SAEs assumed to be related any time, even if occurring more than 30 days after last dose. Though different for each patient, on average, patients could be followed for related AEs/SAEs for ~1 year after termination.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
